## Define a function to write text in typewriter font
tt <- function(x) {
  if (knitr::is_latex_output()) {
    sprintf("\\texttt{%s}", as.character(x))
  } else if (knitr::is_html_output()) {
    sprintf("<tt>%s</tt>", as.character(x))
  } else {
    x
  }
}

# Setup

## Libraries

```{r libs, warning = FALSE}
library(httr)
library(xml2)

library(purrr)
library(stringr)
```

## Retrieve Data from `r tt("AoC")`


```{r get-data, cache = FALSE, messages = FALSE}
session_cookie <- set_cookies(session = keyring::key_get("AoC-GitHub-Cookie"))
base_url <- paste0("https://adventofcode.com/", params$year, "/day/", params$task_nr)
puzzle <- GET(base_url,
              session_cookie) %>% 
  content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
  xml_find_all("///article") %>% 
  lapply(as.character)

parse_puzzle_data <- function(text_block = readClipboard()) {
  if (length(text_block) == 1L) {
    text_block <- text_block %>% 
      str_split("\n") %>% 
      extract2(1L) %>% 
      keep(nzchar)
  }
  text_block %>% 
    str_split("-") %>% 
    do.call(c, .) %>% 
    as.integer()
}

puzzle_data <- local({
  GET(paste0(base_url, "/input"),
      session_cookie) %>% 
    content(encoding = "UTF-8") %>% 
    parse_puzzle_data()
})
```

# Puzzle Day `r params$task_nr`

## Part 1

### Description

```{r show-puzzle-a, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
cat(puzzle[[1]])
```

### Solution

We iterate through the range and count valid passwords. To split the number into digits, 
we use a numeric version instead of the obvious `str_split` as it is faster.

```{r get-solution-1}
split_digits <- function(n) {
  i <- floor(log10(n)) + 1L
  digits <- integer(i)
  while (n > 0) {
    digits[i] <- n %% 10L
    n <- n %/% 10L
    i <- i - 1L
  }
  digits
}

is_valid <- function(n) {
  digits <- split_digits(n)
  any(table(digits) >= 2) &&
    all(diff(digits) >= 0L)
}

count_valid <- function(range = puzzle_data, validator = is_valid) {
  cnt <- 0L
  for (i in seq(range[1L], range[2L])) {
    cnt <- cnt + validator(i)
  }
  cnt
}

count_valid(puzzle_data)
```

## Part 2

### Description

```{r show-puzzle-b, echo = FALSE, results = "asis", eval = length(puzzle) > 1}
cat(puzzle[[2]])
```

### Solution

We use a more complex validator, to make sure that we have at least one pure pair. 

```{r get-solution-2}
is_valid_complex <- function(n) {
  digits <- split_digits(n)
  r <- rle(digits)$length
  all(diff(digits) >= 0L) &&
    any(r == 2L)
}

count_valid(puzzle_data, is_valid_complex)
```
